intro: Pollinia argentea var. lagopus, commonly known as the silver-haired lichen, is a unique lichen species characterized by its distinctive silver or white thallus. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is known for its intricate, branched structure that provides a habitat for various microorganisms. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae and fungi, which contribute to its nutritional needs. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found on bark or rock surfaces in temperate regions. Its slow growth and specialized morphology make it a fascinating subject for botanical study.
